reason: The text describes emotional abuse (put-downs, walking on eggshells) which can escalate to physical harm or contribute to mental health issues. The person is expressing distress and seeking help.

title: User Story: Suicide

reason: Expresses feelings of heaviness and reaching out for support, but lacks explicit suicidal ideation or plan.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
content: Sometimes it feels like the only way to quiet the noise. I hate that I do it. Trying to find healthier coping mechanisms, but it's hard. Anyone else relate? Any tips?
reason: The text expresses a desire to quiet 'the noise' which, given the context of finding coping mechanisms, suggests potential self-harm or suicidal ideation, even if not explicitly stated. The admission of hating the behavior and actively seeking healthier coping mechanisms indicates a degree of awareness and a desire for change, but the struggle suggests ongoing risk.

title: User Story: Overdose

---
